intro: Dontostemon matthioloides, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its small, yellow flowers that bloom in summer, typically arranged in dense clusters. The plant has slender, branching stems and narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Geraniaceae family.
